name: Library Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a gift card for the hotel and had wanted to stay here for a while. This weekend we finally had the time and they had the availability. We arrived to a bottle of champagne (we mentioned that it was a celebratory trip) and a cute little room. It was plush and comfortable.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The concierge offered to make us dinner reservations and local attractions advice. They really fell over themselves to open doors and call the elevator and remind us about the free coffee and cookies and wine and cheese. The continental breakfast was wonderful as well (freshly cut fruit! pastries fresh!). In the evening we came home from a show to our bed turned down and chocolate on the pillows. Lovely!
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The second floor reading area/kitchen nook was well lit and comfortable to relax in. The upstairs "lounge" was lovely during the afternoon, with a beautiful rooftop patio and lots of natural light. The evening it was much more posh than we anticipated (reserved tables for cocktails?), but we still sat for a bit. While the fireplaces were inviting, the lights were a little low to read.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great, a block from Grand Central, with its transportation hub. Ten flights up we could still hear the construction at night, but not enough to keep us awake. Its NYC, it won't be silent.
reviews.title: Samll (by NY standards) but perfectly formed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The only downside, if you can even call it that, was that there were not a lot of books for that theme. Our "museum" room had about two dozen books, none really about the local museums, which would have been nice. This could be different in other rooms.
reviews.title: A place 'designed for me'!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 5 night stay at the Library hotel was quite nice. I've never been to New York before, and was excited to stay in a manhattan hotel that was right in the thick of things. The hotel is located close to the New York Public Library and Grand Central Terminal, as well as a fair walk (20min) from Central Park. The rooms were small, but nicely furnished, I realize that space is limited in manhattan. The hotel offered a complimentary wine and cheese every night which was delightful! Breakfast in the morning was also very nice, they offered many cereals, muffins, coffees, teas, fresh fruit, oatmeal and juices. There is also a rooftop bar/lounge which is very pretty. The staff was polite for the most part. Upon checking out we realized we had been charged for using the phone in the room. The staff that we initially dealt with in trying to correct this was extremely rude and told us "it was ridiculous for you to assume using the phone was free" and that "at this hotel, we don't NEED you to stay here, we get enough business as it is." Once that statement was said, an assistant manager came over to apologize and helped us with the bill. She told us that we were right in that it doesn't actually say on the phone in the rooms that there is a charge for using them and she quickly removed the charges from our bill. Other than the rudeness of the one desk staff I would say our experience at the Library hotel was excellent. I'm sure there are other hotels in New York that are worth checking out where they would be extremely glad to have you stay as a guest. I will never forget that desk staff telling me "we don't NEED you to stay here...". And that is very sad!
reviews.title: snooty but savvy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here in a petite full room the day after Christmas. The room was small, but well-organized and did not feel too small for us. We paid about $300 including taxes.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff were friendly, the room was very nice, and the reading room was lovely. There is a daily complimentary wine and cheese reception in the early evening, which we were invited to visit both on the day we checked in and again even after we had checked out. (The hotel had held onto our bags while we were out and when we returned to pick them up at around 6:00 p.m., the concierge suggested we have a glass of wine in the reading room before catching our train home.)
reviews.title: Great Holiday Deal for a Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is pretty convenient, as it is quite close to Grand Central.
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After making reservation online directly with the hotel, they phoned to confirm and let me know about concierge services. Never had a hotel do that before! I had them arrange town car service as my arrival and departure flights were both in the wee hours of the AM. There was a bit of lack of clarity as to limo pricing (roundtrip vs. one-way), but that is the only thing I can fault the hotel on.
reviews.title: Library Perfection for our long weekend from uk

likes.disliked: — shallow bath not suitable for nice soak

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I heard NY hotel rooms are so tiny, not clean, and staffs are not kind.
reviews.title: I love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But my preconception had gone when I could have a pleasant trip to USA with Library hotel.
reviews.title: What a Great Find in New York!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small but comfortable, towels are new and clean, I couldn't find any dusts or hairs in the cleaned bathroom.
reviews.title: Best staff one could hope for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: staffs are frinendly, and breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon Destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want to stay again.
reviews.title: Horrible Beds; Uncaring Management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 10 days in Manhattan and, after a lot of research in Trip Advisor, we decided to stay at the Library Hotel. We love to stay in boutiques hotels and we were not disappointed. Every hotel employee was extremely friendly and kind, specially the guys at the concierge. On the second floor, the hotel serves a complimentary continental breakfast that is very nice, plus a self-serve espresso-cappuccino machine. The teas and coffees are available all day, along with pastries and cookies. These provide a welcome respite after a hard day of shopping or sightseeing, not to mention the wine cheese reception every evening. The location is perfect, next to the Public Library, and Grand Central Station is a 2 minute walk. The rooftop bar is another attraction, with both indoor and outdoor areas to sit.The rooms were comfortable, silent and well-kept .We definitely recommend this hotel!!!
reviews.title: A Wonderful hotel in a fantastic location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at The Library for a week over New Year's. Our experience was excellent in all respects. The room was lovely, very clean and the maid service prompt and thorough. The room was very light with all of the windows which gave a great view of Madison Ave. as well as 41st street.
reviews.title: Outstanding New Year's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Front Desk staff was extremely courteous and attentive to any needs we had and all the employees we encountered greeted us, asked how we were doing and was there anything they could do to help us.
reviews.title: New Year in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: The Continental Breakfast was great only to be outdone by the 3 hour wine and cheese reception each day. This plus the fact that the Reading Room is open 24 hours a day with tea, coffee, espresso, etc. really makes for a great experience.
reviews.title: Cosy Luxury in crazy Midtown!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a very convenient location for Grand Central, subway and bus service.
reviews.title: WOW!! Fab hotel, amazing location & superb staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic hotel. The staff are super friendly, nothing is too much trouble for them...and they remembered us from our stay 2 years before. The themed rooms are very tastefully done, linens are high quality and the bathroom is substantial and well appointed with quality toiletries. But the real winner is the reading room on the 2nd floor. A place to relax at any time of day - or night - good quality tea, coffee and hot chocolate (compulsory when it's snowing outside), and the nightly wine and cheese reception gives you a great chance to relax, recharge your batteries, then head back out into the hustle and bustle of this wonderful city. We will be back...it's the only place we'll stay in New York.
reviews.title: A home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed everything at the Library Hotel. The service is unbelievably friendly. The hotel itself is charming and perfectly located. We almost stayed at the Sofitel and am happy that we chose here instead; it isn't as stuffy as the Sofitel seems.
reviews.title: Fantastic service and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010
reviews.text: I stayed at the library hotel for one night with my boyfriend from February 12-13. It was both of our first times at this hotel and we will definitely be going back! We also recommended it to our family and all of our friends. We stayed in the Germanic religion room and the book selection in there was great. The hotel was beautiful, with such a unique concept, and the room was the perfect size. We loved the complimentary wine and cheese and continental breakfast. The reading room, poetry garden, and lounge at night were a lot of fun to visit. It was also fun to be able to choose complimentary movies from their large DVD selection. The service was great; staff was friendly and attentive!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location and amazing service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Library hotel from 3rd Feb to 8th Feb. It was my partner's birthday so I requested The Love room (which has a balcony), which fortunately we got and it really helped make our stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: We arrived really late (0030) and we were greeted by a really cheerful and friendly front desk. Once the formalities had been completed we were shown up to our room and were pleasantly surprised. It was spacious, very clean, had modern decor but then there was the balcony to the room which has views of the New York Public Library plus up and down Madison Avenue. We enjoyed a glass of Prosecco that evening on the balcony (at the suggestion of the front desk) which was a really romantic way to start our trip.
reviews.title: This is a welcoming lovely hotel that actually does feel like home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I just came back from a short stay at the Library Hotel. I had picked the hotel, because I remembered that we spent a lovely evening on their roof terrace a year ago. Reading the reviews made me curious about the rest of the hotel.
reviews.title: A really cozy place - Enjoyed my stay !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everybody at the front desk was very helpful and friendly and we did a swift check-in. The lobby is very understated and minimalist, but the book shelves made it look ‘cosy’.
reviews.title: Extremely Quiet and Classy
My favorite in Manhattan
reviews.text: I had booked a junior suit for a special discount price (499 $) and since this is even for New York a substantial amount of money, I expected a lot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was not disappointed. The room looked exactly like the picture on their website. While a lot of room was wasted on a front room/hallway, it was still spacious and airy, due to a lot of windows. All of them had nice wooden blinds, which gave the room a warm feeling, as did the room colours, mostly in beige and dark wood. There was a small sofa in one corner with two armchairs and a large flat screen TV. The bathroom was spacious and nicely decorated, with all the amenities one needs.
reviews.title: The Library Hotel - We Love Your Style
Superlative hotel experience
reviews.text: Having lived in New York, I knew that this was not going to be the quietest of all streets in Mid-Town. It was definitely noisy, but the windows are very sound-proof.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Library Hotel from the reviews on this site and were not disappointed. The trip over New Year had originally been booked to celebrate my boyfriend's 40th birthday, but became a double celebration as we recently got engaged. On arrival to our room, we were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of Proseco waiting for us with a congratulations card - a lovely touch.
reviews.title: A great place to stay to celebrate NYE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Library Hotel is well placed in midtown Manhattan. Just 10 mins walk from the centre of Times Square (down 42nd Street) or the Empire State Building (straight down 5th Ave). The traffic noise can be a bit of a pain (our room overlooked Madison Ave) but didn't disrupt our sleep.
reviews.title: The stay was excellent..the after..not so much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The front desk was very helpful in booking tours and also providing recommendations for dinner. The staff around for breakfast and afternoon cheese and wine were always friendly, polite and helpful - even recognised us after the second day and asked if we wanted our bagels toasted!
reviews.title: Another superb stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary evening wine and cheese reception is a great benefit and allows you the time to catch your breathe from a day of sightseeing, before heading out for the evening. The 24-hour complimentary tea/coffee is also very good, especially as in-room tea and coffee is not offered.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also had dinner at the Madison & Vine restaurant - lovely food and great service.
reviews.title: Exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Spent one night (Valentine's Day) at the Library Hotel as I had a meeting the next block over. I was able to secure a small room (full size bed) for around $250 which is great for NYC. Received a friendly call from reservations a day or two before arrival confirming my room and reservations.
reviews.title: Gem of a place in Midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really was impressed by this hotel - although the room was small, the layout was smart and there was space for everything. Nice details throughout - high end linens, heated floor in the bathroom, pretty art, and of course, about two dozen books. The bathroom was quite large for the size of the room - large vanity and full size tub.
reviews.title: a beautiful haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free prosecco, wine, fruit and cheese each evening, as well as the free continental breakfast and free wifi make this hotel truly a great deal. Comfortable space on the second floor to eat, drink and explore all of the books. It really was a classy, warm and FREE place to eat, drink and browse through the hotel's many many books.
reviews.title: Book here and shelve your other plans
Respite
reviews.text: Only one "con" - with my room being on the third floor right on Madison Avenue, it was pretty noisy. To be completely expected in the heart of NYC, so not reallly a "con" for the hotel itself.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location right on Madison Avenue near Grand Central. VERY friendly and helpful staff. Will stay here again for sure if the price remains right.
reviews.title: Great place to stay and terrific service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our very first trip to New York, so that my daughter could attend an NYU campus tour. The hotel is everything described on it's website and more! We stayed in the Deluxe Queen room, and took advantage of the "Book Lovers" promotion. Even before our arrival, their team of concierges offered several ideas for things to see and do during our stay. They also arranged for a car service to pick us up at the airport, and this was well worth the additional cost (over a taxi) in order to be whisked right from the airport to the hotel. Alvin showed us to our 10th floor room, and was very friendly and helpful in answering all our questions! The room itself was very clean and at the end of the hall, with a view of Madison Avenue. The clever use of mirrors made the room seem much larger. The bathroom was super clean and spacious, with great products. I loved that the window in the room opened a bit. We loved the minibar, and the prices were surprisingly reasonable. We had breakfast each morning (included in the room rate) on the 2nd floor, and enjoyed fresh fruit salad, yogurt, bagels, coffee, etc. Everything was well stocked and delicious. The rooftop bar and terrace is also really amazing. We also ordered room service several times, and the food was delivered quickly, and was also delicious. We felt very safe and secure at this hotel, and liked its central location in Manhattan. On the way to the airport at the end of our stay, I realized that I had accidentally left some personal items in the room safe. There was no way we had time to return to the hotel and still make our flight, but one call to Jessica at the front desk, and she had the items retrieved and sent to me via overnight delivery. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who values location, security and cleanliness in a hotel.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights and wished we could have stayed for more. Complimentary breakfasts and wine and cheese in the evenings in the reading room were delightful. Customer service was the best I have received from a hotel in NY. Rooftop bar was absolutely fantastic with the greatest cocktail menu I have come across.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and I spent 2 nights in this small delightful hotel. Our room the deluxe double was quite small but it was adequate and the furniture was comfortable and fittings good quality. Having coffee and pastries available all day and the cheese and wine served in the evening was a nice touch. The day we left they stored our luggage until we needed to leave the city and suggested we could help ourselves to the coffee etc.. when we returned to collect our luggage in the afternoon. The staff helped with advice on transport & restaurants (definitely go to the Madison Bistro if you like French food), even small change for the bus!..We will definitely return to enjoy the roof top room and garden in warmer weather.
reviews.title: excellent place to stay
Excellent Hotel.
reviews.text: This Hotel was superb in every way we could of imagined. I would firstly like to say that we were scheduled to go there on 5th December 2012, but due to unfortunate circumstances at the very last minute we had to cancel our trip, little did I know my husband neither myself had put any holiday insurance in place. The Library did not hesitate in rebooking our break for when it was convenient for us they were incredibly helpful and there was no extra charge, it was easy to transfer our break to new revised dates on 21st February 2013.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived 21st and was so overwhelmed by the hotel, staff and what was included in our stay..Breakfast was served between 7 and 10.30, with a great continental choice to keep you going for the morning. The lounge on the second floor had a tea and coffee free facility area with fresh pastry and biscuits on tap, and from 5 to 8 every evening a wide range of cheese olives, nuts crackers and breads would be readily available along with excellent wine free of charge. It was truly outstanding service start to finish. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: The BEST!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days in August 2008. The staff and the information/service that they provided were superb. Room (junior suite) great. Location central. Breakfast, snacks, wine and cheese,what more can you ask for. We were very pleased, thought it good value and would go again/recommend.
reviews.title: a treat in new york
Spot on service, fab location, great atmosphere
reviews.text: My husband and I got engaged at the Library Hotel in their roofop Poetry Garden a couple years ago, so this boutique gem is incredibly special to us both. We recently returned for a quick anniversary celebration and were very happy to once again experience the charm and amenities of the Library.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The reception/lobby staff here are incredibly accommodating, approachable and gracious. How often are you personally contacted by a hotel to ensure your stay is in order? Hotel location is fantastic (Weather permitting, walk over to Bryant Park Grill for an outdoor lunch and a spin on the carousel!)
reviews.title: Great Hotel shame about some of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We adore the Library for its uniqueness, character and overall ambiance. It's also great to have bottled water, good coffee at any hour, breakfast and wine/cheese at your disposal. The value here is excellent. Don't hesitate to book. We will be back!
reviews.title: Simply, perfect!

likes.liked: — The top floor bar balcony and the reading room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, daughter and I stayed in a junior suite at The Library Hotel for a week long stay in New York and have to say that nearly every service offered at this hotel is second to none- room cleaning and turn down service in the evening is a wonderfully luxurious touch (if not a little inconsiderate of the global environment). The biggest let down for us was, I hate to say, the overall standard of service offered by a few of the main reception staff, who could be haughty and even rude when approached for information and advice. This spoiled an otherwise great trip!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Couldn't imagine staying anywhere else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not great weather, but who cared? My Christmas gift to my husband for Chelsea Gallery blitz, one night hotel and dinner was GREAT, mostly thanks to the wonderful staff and facilities at the Library Hotel. (I based my booking on Tripadvisor reviews and the location.) It was a wonderful time and we plan to come back often. I am always initially nervous about booking a new place because I am married to a high maintenance, 6'2" guy with a few allergies. The Library Hotel was great, the room, the bathroom, the bar on the 14th fl(?) and even the new restaurant on the corner. Only thing I would tell other people is the room itself was on the small side, but the bed was not, the bathroom was not, and the furnishings were stylish and sleek. In NY, you never sit around in your room anyway. The free light breakfast was icing on the cake. Even in January, the hotel seemed buzzing with people, and the staff handled it all with such grace and humor. Count us in the Rave department. Thank YOU!!
reviews.title: Wonderful home-away-from-home, we loved the hotel and the location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect hotel for location, privacy and all the amenities. Easy access wi-fi, great free breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese, fireplace access, and perfect service in every way. Beats every hotel I've stayed in NYC, and I've stayed in many.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to NYC. We spent a good deal of time researching hotels on TripAdvisor and decided to book the Library. We feel as if we hit the lottery! This boutique hotel was utterly charming and perfect in every way. True, the rooms are small, but we understand that's typical of older New York hotels. The location is great -- a block from Grand Central and from the NY Public Library. Our first morning (a Saturday) we found a street fair on Madison Ave. My wife was in heaven. Easy walking to 5th Ave shops and St. Patricks. The hotel itself just oozes coziness. The continental breakfast is great (pastries, fruit, and good coffee), and there are pastries and coffee available all day (and night). The rooms are comfortable and surprisingly quiet. The staff is friendly and very helpful. We very definitely will stay here again on our next visit.
reviews.title: It Made Our Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Comfortable hotel located right in the middle of things in midtown, just a block from the NY Public Library. The book themes are fun and accommodations were pleasant, if a bit small (the curse of Manhattan). Staff were very helpful and light breakfast was a nice touch. PS: they don't advertise it, but guests can ask for a day pass to NY Sports Clubs for a workout.
reviews.title: Midtown hotel with fresh theme and none of the generic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in many large-chain hotels over the years, this was a refreshing break from the norm. The service from start to finish was excellent, and everything has that 'polished' feel without being pretentious or twee.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: we just arrived back from a fabulous week in nyc, and, i have to say that staying at the Library Hotel was a large part of that. The staff at the hotel are ALL wonderful and helpful, but Igor at the front desk is the BEST. All of the staff were helpful with recommendations, reservations, and a cheery hello. The hotel is IMPECCABLY clean and well appointed. We stayed in a suite, which was perfect for the two of us ( a little more expensive). The continental breakfast was just enought to get us going, and the rooftop bar is wonderful for relaxation. We didn't utilize the wine and cheese too much due to our schedule. Overall, I can only think of one other hotel in the world that MIGHT be better. You will not be disappointed!!!
reviews.title: best hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at The Library Hotel last week. Our experience was excellent. The staff practically fell over one another trying to be helpful -- and they were in many ways, but always without being intrusive. During our two night stay every encounter with hotel staff was perfect, so we would say the strongest selling point for the hotel is service.
reviews.title: The Library Hotel - A Great Read!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Nevertheless, the physical plant merits comment. Simply, the public areas were stunning, quite a surprise for such a small hotel. Our room was a good size by New York standards with every necessity anticipated and provided, right down to the bath robe and slippers.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel; fabulous staff!
Pretty good really
reviews.text: In terms of location, we found the hotel to be far enough away from Times Square to be peaceful but close enough to be within walking distance. Fifth Avenue shopping was only a couple of blocks away as was Bryant Park, a very pleasant place for an al fresco lunch and to watch the world go by.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we stay at the Library again? You bet! We found the library to be a great read.
reviews.title: amazing stay

likes.liked: — staff, champagne and wine reception, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: What a great hotel. The Library is without doubt the best hotel in New York that I have ever stayed in. The Lobby and Front desk areas make you feel that you are going to be treated as an individual and not just another travel agent booking. The friendly and professional front desk staff confiirm this impression.
reviews.title: What a great hotel

likes.liked: — The quality feel and being treated as an individual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The single rooms are small but beautifully appointed and contain everything one needs for a comfortable and relaxed stay. The same applies to the bathroom area. A big plus is the quality of the soundproofing both between room and external.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is just what a Continential breakfast should be.
reviews.title: Everything the Reviews had said - and more!

likes.liked: — High standard accomodation and friendly efficient service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Terrace Bar offers an indoor and outdoor environment, is comfortably appointed and staffed by attractive, effiicient and professional individuals.
reviews.title: Oasis in the heart of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will be back
reviews.title: Better than most

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Staff very attentive and helpful Also our room delightful with a view of the public library which is a truly inspiring place to visit Good location for walking everywhere but also very close to grand central to access all other areas New York Restaurant next door had good meals with great steak close by. Books abound if you have time to put your feet up with so much to do here. All in all we would return but might stay in the smaller rooms as you only need to sleep there, but the larger room was glorious as was the readily available nibbles and wine from 4 pm You can't go wrong staying here! Only downside might be if you eat very late you may need to cab to other parts NY with more night life
reviews.title: Three wise monkeys welcome you daily

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at the Library a number of years ago and was quite satisfied, so decided to come back on a recent visit to NYC...the Library was still as pleasant as I remembered, albeit our room ('botany--500.04') was quite small. Great location, steps from Grand Central. Front desk staff very courteous and attentive. If you check in on foursquare, you get a complementary bottle of wine. Plus, a fan of the wine and cheese hour in the Reading Room (free) and breakfast (free). The room was ~$340 around the holidays. There is a great selection of top movies that can be borrowed also, in addition to the books in the room if you're interested in your room's 'topic' (based on the library catalog system)
reviews.title: 2nd stay....still meets expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed our stay here the week before Christmas! The hotel is conveninently located within walking distance of most attractions! They offer a complimentary happy hour with wines, prosecco, cheeses, olives, crackers, fruit, etc that was delicious!! The staff were super friendly and helpful! Our room was clean and a bit more roomy than other places we've stayed in NYC. We will definitely be staying at the Library Hotel upon our return to NYC and recommend that you do too!!

reviews.text: This was just right for us, allowing us to walk nearly everywhere we went, and feel like we were in an intimate setting without the too-close-quarters feeling of a smaller B&B inn. The $25/day parking deal for our car was a nice plus, too. As book readers and collectors, we loved being surrounded by all those books and book-themed rooms. The room was small, and perhaps if we'd needed to spend more time in it, we would have felt crowded, but for sleeping and resting it was fine. There were glitches with the room safe, TV remote, and WiFi, but we didn't let those bother us, and the staff was very helpful.
reviews.title: Great stay in a perfect-size perfect-location hotel.

reviews.text: Almost everything was perfect! The service and the cleanliness were most impressive. It was so nice after being in subways and around nyc all day to know I was going back to a clean room and I am a VERY tough customer when it comes to clean rooms! The rooms are small but there's too much to see and do in New York to stay in your room much anyway! The ONLY complaint I have is that our bed was not comfortable at all. However, due to the cleanliness, the service, the amenities, and the location we would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others. I just can't imagine a better location (1 block from Grand Central Terminal) or a friendlier and better trained staff!
reviews.title: Great find!

The bar, restaurant and reading room are unique and welcomed in an ever busy non-personal transit world of the traveller. Recommend to those who do not like the high end hotel chains but still want to benefit from the luxury.
reviews.title: Perpetual Guest

reviews.text: We had a great stay here recently and it is so well situated just near Grand Central and within walking distance of so many of the sights. The staff were excellent, especially the poor bell boys who handled our luggage (a lot). I did have an issue with one staff member (see below) but on the whole had a good stay.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was with a friend for 2 nights and then alone for 2 so had 2 different rooms. The first was the junior suite which was very roomy and well appointed. We did use the sofa bed which took up quite a bit of room but we were only in the room to sleep. It was noisy as it fronted Madison ave but ear plugs worked a treat - I even slept through a major accident right outside apparently.
reviews.title: An almost perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been in NYC many, many times in previous years. Had never even heard of the Library Hotel. What a shame! It was great. The rooms were small, it certainly was not the Four Seasons, but the people were kind, helpful and despite some problems with the facility, they worked diligently to solve all our problems and compensate us for our inconvenience. These things happen when you are on a vacation sometimes and viewing them as an adventure to share with your friends and family upon your return and not a ruination of a trip is all in the attitude of both yourself and the hotel staff. The rooftop bar was a gift that allows you to stand and admire the greatest city in the world while sharing a romantic cocktail. Bryant Park is a "hop, skip and a jump" (sorry for the cliche) and if you hit it right, you can see evening films in the outdoors.
reviews.title: A Grand New Experience

likes.liked: — The kindness and availability and willingness of the staff to be of service
likes.disliked: — Could have been more centrainly located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms, as mentioned were small, but we've stayed at the Columbus and we know what small is -- these were gigantic in comparison. They had roses, a bottle of champagne and chocolates in our room (by mistake, I'm sure), but when pressed to make sure there hadn't been a mistake, they assured us, it was no mistake and told us to keep them (I think it was a mistake, but they certainly held to their position on that one). You have to try this hotel at least once. You'll love it for sure. Just relax and enjoy.
reviews.title: It's All True!
honeymoon hotel
reviews.text: Yes- it's all true! The Library Hotel really is as good as everyone says! We chose it based on Tripadvisor reviews and it met or exceeded our expectations. Good location, very comfortable well equipped rooms, friendly helpful staff.....the list goes on. The reading room where they serve complimentary breakfast and evening drinks is lovely, with coffee also available all day. We also liked the rooftop bar. We had dinner one evening in the adjoining restaurant, Madison and Vine, and enjoyed it very much.

reviews.title: Attractive Hotel with small suprises
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again if we return to New York.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was an absolute gem of a find in New York. My wife and started our honeymoon in NY and the hotel helped make the trip perfect. The small touches of front desk staff remembering their guests each morning as you leave for a day's shopping made the experience so much more personal. The breakfast is great, the location is excellent (5th Avenue 10 mins walk, Central park 20 mins walk, Empire State 10 mins walk), the books adorning the walls everywhere was absolutely fantastic and the view of the New York City Library is beautiful from the Reading Room. Make sure you try out Madison and Vine the hotel's restaurant fronting Madison Ave, the food is top class, slightly pricey but worth every cent!
reviews.title: The Library - A Delightful Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is so much I could say about this hotel, right from the minute we arrived to the minute we left. Much has already been said here about the attention to detail and the manner in which the staff look after you. Literally, every staff member I came across had a smile on their face and couldn't have been more helpful. We stayed for 3 nights in a deluxe room (floor 12, the Native American room). The size was perfect for our needs, larger than we had expected. We liked the dim light in the bathroom (as well as a brighter light) so as not to wake others up in the middle of the night! Plenty of space for clothes, with a wardrobe and plenty of draws and as it was our anniversary we had a bottle of fizz and a card waiting for us. In terms of breakfast and complimentary snacks/drinks throughout the day; we thought wouldn't use this much as we'd be out and about, but once we'd appreciated the calm atmosphere and the selection both for breakfast and cheese and wine later we made the most of this each day.
reviews.title: Perfect for our 10 year Wedding Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple

Madison and Vine (restaurant downstairs) was good for a meal, although we felt that there were better places to eat in the surrounding areas. Try John's Pizzeria in Times Sq for a good pizza (although the small pizza is big enough to share between 2!!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here 4 nights in early May, and it was the best location (btw - I highly recommned Springtime in NY). I've been to NYC several times on business, but none as a tourist, and it was my wife's first trip here. The rooms were clean and nice - the hotel makes the best use of the limited space in this 14 story building. I read much about the small rooms, but they weren't that small, and we were either taking a nap or sleeping after a long day walking around town. The central location was perfect for walking all around mid-town. The best part of the hotel was the second floor - it was quiet (great after a day or two of non-stop city activity) and you could snack all day long. Because of the central location, we would walk down to the Empire State bldg, then to Grand Central terminal and the area for 2 or 3 hours, then swing by the room (and 2nd floor) for a quick break, some lemonade and a snack, then head out to Times Square. The staff always recognized us when we walked through the lobby (you wouldn't get this in a mega hotel). I can't imagine staying somewhere else the next time I head to midtown.
reviews.title: When you think New York City, this is it...
