It is ideally located so as to return to it on a few occasions during the day to refresh before facing "life outside" again.
reviews.title: Lovely staff--but very noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By the way there are plenty of books to read if you find the time!!!
reviews.title: Fulfilled our Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the Library Hotel couldn't be nicer. The breakfast room is lovely and the food is fresh. Even the elaborate espresso machine turns out stellar coffee. Every non-resting moment we spent there was great.
reviews.title: Beautiful and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: I'm a former New Yorker who stays in the city many times a year. I found Library, where I visited this week for the first time, a fine boutique hotel without the attitude. Service was truly exceptional, as with the doorman/concierge who went mia on Madison to find me an otherwise impossible cab, and as with his colleague who told me about the minibar, whose contents will be charged to your account if they're moved for over 15 seconds.
reviews.title: Splendid, but rooftop garden sometimes off-limits

likes.disliked: — inability to use roof deck at my discretion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I booked the Love Suite which has the only terrace in the hotel. The room was not quite a suite as I know the term, but it, and the bathroom -in which 3 people could get organized - were truly spacious, beautifully appointed and, well, really interesting. The terrace overlooking Madison was worth the price of admission.
reviews.title: Library Hotel excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rub: the rooftop garden terrace, which opens late in the day, is not managed by the hotel. I found in my 1 night stay I could not go there at various times because there were private/corporate events. If the outdoor space is important to you, contact the hotel, and they'll put you in touch with the garden's management compay so you can see what's scheduled for your visit.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Library Hotel was a great choice for our trip to New York. It is in a great location, close to the subway, shopping and great restaurants. The service was flawless. The complimentary breakfast and wine and cheese in the afternoon was really good and a great way to relax before going out for the night. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We highly recommend the Library Hotel.
reviews.title: Unbelievable hotel - book a stay there!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: What an absolute delight! The Library Hotel is wonderful. We stayed there for my sister's wedding in NY last week & we couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. The rooms were small-ish but nicely decorated, very clean & had all sorts of nice touches such as a bathrobe, toiletries, DVD player etc. Without exception the staff were kind, helpful & courteous. One of the reception team helped me with bookings for a ladies' night out the day before the wedding, made all the 'phone calls & then presented all the information on a beautifully typed note with times/ 'phone numbers etc. On the wedding day itself, all the family members were left lovely little notes, champagne & fruit in our rooms - we didn't ask for this - very thoughtful & much appreciated. I also agree with a previous review - no-one lurked intrusively for a tip. The breakfast was great - fresh & plenty of choice. The complimentary wine & cheese every evening was also a bonus. I cannot recommend this place highly enough.
reviews.title: Dignity in New York

likes.liked: — Intellectual environment combined with quality care and accomodation - like home.
likes.disliked: — It's so far away from Australia

reviews.title: Perfect friendly small hotel in the middle of New York
reviews.text: From arriving mid wine and cheese (perfect!) to our stay over the next 4 days we were very pleased to have found such a friendly, comfortable and well located hotel in New York. Having researched (extensively!) where to stay we were very pleased with our decision to choose the library hotel as the 'reading room' for breakfast, daytime coffees and snacks, then the wine and cheese meant that there was always something to eat and drink whenever sightseeing/shopping had got the better of you. This set up also meant you got to meet and chat to other guests which is always nice to compare notes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: However as mentioned in other reviews yes, the rooms are small, but they are very nice. Dont expect to be able to open your suitcases and use the bed at the same time is all!
reviews.title: Another Satisfied Customer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: Would have given the hotel an excellent rating if the espresso machine hadn't been out of action for most of our stay (which for a jet-lagged husband was very important!).
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel in the middle of New York hustle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly - got good dinner reservation advice from the vast array of choices available.
reviews.title: Loved it! Even if I didn't know what to expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Would stay here again and will be recommending.
reviews.title: Best NY hotel for solo women

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to go with the Library Hotel because we'd read about it in a guide book and it sounded interesting, Besides it had all these great reviews here going for it. We were not disappointed. The staff were extremely helpful overall, but especially with local directions and suggestions. We did have a minor plumbing problem right after we checked in around 1am, but they had someone come up and fix it immediately. The reading room with its breakfast, free NY Times, wine and cheese and 24 hour cookies was a great extra touch. So was the free internet access. We went with a standard size room which was quite nice and while not big was certainly adequate in size. The hotel's location near Grand Central Station, 5th Ave, the NY Library (interesting tour by the way) is great as well. The books are both a fun theme and quite useful. My wife read a couple from the hotel's shelves while we were there. The Library Hotel is fairly pricey, but then so are so many NY hotels. If you're on a budget it's probably a poor choice, but if you want to indulge a bit the service and extras are worthy of a far more expensive hotel.
reviews.title: Another rave review

likes.liked: — Great service and lots of extras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from a weekend anniversary trip to NYC with a stay at the Library Hotel. We had a wonderful time! We read many reviews here on tripadvisor and decided to go for it. We were looking for something a little different and we were very happy! We checked in to the hotel late, at about 10:00 p.m. on Friday night. The desk staff was friendly and helpful. They had glasses of wine sent up to our room shortly after our check-in. (They did that for the couple that checked in right before us, too.)
reviews.title: The little things that make it great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, the Mathematics room, was tidy, comfortable and, as mentioned by many reviewers, small. But not uncomfortably small- after all, how much space do you need in a hotel room? For what? =) There was a full-sized bed, a built-in dresser/vanity/tv cabinet, two nightstands, a chair and a small bookcase. There was enough room for the two of us to move around, as needed. The bed was good and comfy (with a feather-top and a down comforter), though the pillows left a little to be desired...
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bathroom was a good size, clean and comfortable with a nice shower and a jar of cotton balls and cotton swabs! (I thought that was a cute touch.)
reviews.title: Lovely Library

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: In our brief time in NY we partook of the complimentary breakfast (a wonderful way to start the day) with bagels, cereal, fruit salad, pastries, coffees, teas and juices. We also enjoyed the 5-8pm wine and cheese- a great way to relax before dinner!! After our dinner we returned and sat out for a drink on the roof-top lounge. The weather was perfect and the view a lot of fun!! (The drinks were a little pricey, but I guess average for NY prices? $12 for a cocktail, $12+ for a glass of wine) But it was worth sitting out there and enjoying the evening!
reviews.title: What a Great Staff and Location
Library Hotel - a repeater
reviews.text: In a world of increasing uniformity and plasticity, it is a joy to find a unique oasis. Library hotel is such a place. From check-in by a smart, friendly front desk staff, each of whom serves as a well-informed concierge, to the sleek, well- appointed rooms, each distinguished by a literary theme, to the glorious upper-floor public spaces perfect for a rainy afternoon read in front of the fireplace, Library Hotel is a repeater. I plan to make it my home away from home from now on.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!!
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I travelled to New York with another couple and stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming. They were keen to assist in finding and booking reservations at restaurants. When we stayed it was very very warm and staff always allowed us to take an extra bottle of water up to our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Breakfast wasn't very varied but all the basics were there; cereals, bagels, tea and coffee. The complimentary wine and cheese from 5pm to 8pm every evening was brilliant and exactly what the average tourist needs after a long day of sight seeing and in preparation for a night out. The rooftop bar on the top floor is excellent on a hot New York night, with glittering views of the city.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Library Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: The rooms were relatively small, but very clean and well appointed with large bathrooms. The hotel itself is in an ideal location, just 10 minutes walk from the Empire State Building. It is close to some good restaurants and I would definately recommend the Pershing Square just a block away.
reviews.title: Great birthday weekend trip.
Amazing Trip!!
reviews.text: All in all a brilliant holiday in a perfect hotel. Next time i go to NY I will definately be stayng at the Library Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Library hotel is a real oasis of calm in the otherwise frenetic big city. Located close to Grand Central station (including the bus shuttle to JFK) and handy for the subway, the hotel is a great find. Each room is individually designed to match a different literary theme and although the rooms a very small (this is New York after all), the guest lounge and rooftop bars are good places to chill out and relax.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm in the big apple

likes.disliked: — Small rooms (as is the NYC way)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff were faultless and little touches like the DVD library (including 100 films all set in New York) were a really nice touch.
reviews.title: NYC at its best.

likes.liked: — the hotel theme and the extremely conscientious staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The very conscientious and considerate staff at the Library Hotel made my brief stay in the city a great pleasure. I arrived two hours before scheduled check-in time and the staff hurried to arrange a room for me. Following a very brief wait (less than 45 minutes) I was situated in an “upgraded” room – larger than I had reserved -at no additional cost. Even during my brief (one night) stay I made use of the library sitting area, business center, wine and cheese hour and rooftop bar. Can’t imagine anything that could have made my stay more enjoyable. The wonderful staff sets the tone, the beautiful accommodations and quaint setting conveys the mood, and the amenities complete the package. I can’t wait until I can return with my wife for a much longer stay.
reviews.title: More than perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I must say I was reluctant to write this review because I want this little gem of a hotel to remain my secret.
reviews.title: Wonderful boutique hotel

likes.disliked: — Elevators (slow, shared with Bookends' patrons at night)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: djm
reviews.title: Faboulous visit to the Library!

likes.liked: — Excellent location, pristine hotel, fabulous staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights.
reviews.title: A gem! great everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the petite room- the room was small but that was expected.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel,could not fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Complimentary breakfast and cheese & wine in the evening.
reviews.title: Best Choice Hotel - Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location!
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing we didn't enjoy was the fact the bed was hard.
reviews.title: Flawless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay in NYC two or three times a year, and this was the best hotel for location, cleanliness, quiet and comfort. The rooms are very small, but beautifully designed, with lovely bed linens, bathroom, and colors. The complimentary evening wine and cheese plus European breakfast are nice touches. The rooftop bar is lovely, though very expensive (drinks @ $15 each). With Grand Central around the corner, and within walking distance of the NY Public Library, Bryant Park and the theater district, the Library Hotel is in an ideal location. This definitely is a perfect weekend hotel with your spouse or partner.
reviews.title: Great for couples

likes.disliked: — Rooms a bit on the small side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My fifth time at the Library and excellent as usual. For tourist activities, its location is great, next to Grand Central, minutes walk to Times Square, restuarants & bars in easy walking distance. The rooms are beautifully decorated, beds very comfortable, no street noise, nice amenties. The common areas are perfect for relaxing or getting coffee and a snack. Attached restuarant has some very good entrees and desserts. Concierge was always spot-on with restuarant recommendations also. The only negative I could say is if you are used to the big TVs at home, these are std smaller tvs (19" I think) but why would you go to NYC to watch tv? Staff is friendly and helpful at every encounter.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel, service and location
Great Find
reviews.text: A fabulous find! The staff was gracious and the room was superbly decorated. My favorite was the room on the 2nd floor where you could relax and enjoy breakfast, wine in the evening or just read. What a comfortable hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: "Far cry" from business type hotels
reviews.text: Stayed for 6 nites , fortunate to be upgraded to "Junior Suite", no isssues with room size (standard rooms noted as "small" ?).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Everything about the place is "warm", no regular upstarts telling you to get in line. Whenever we approached the front desk,their offer of assistance always preceded our requests. Staff warm,sincere,would like to think it's deliberate to employ these type of people, because it works! Sometimes in Manhattan the hotels lean to business class or carry the attitude that there's more where you came from, consequently you don't get that personal service. You get it in the Library though!
reviews.title: Terrible staff, saved only just by fabulous library
Impeccable as always
reviews.text: My fourth time staying at The Library; that should tell you everything! Thanks Igor, for giving us exceptional service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arrived late on our first day and was pleasantly surprised by the friendly welcome from reception. Even though we arrived just after the wine and cheese had finished, we were offered a plate of cheese and wine in our room.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay

likes.liked: — The library on fthe second floor, somewhere quiet to hang out and relax.

reviews.title: Will go back!
reviews.text: The library on second floor was another haven, somewhere pleasant to hang out. Good selection of books around the hotel, tea, coffee, pastries and biscuits available 24/7. The location of the hotel made it convenient to drop in during the day in between various activities and have a short break and quick snack. Saved a fortune not frequenting Starbucks.

reviews.title: Loved the Library Hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast is described as continental which it is, bagels, Danish pastries, yoghurt, cereal, fruit salad, fruit, hot and cold beverages. Went at different times during stay and didn't have a problem with food availability as it was regularly refreshed. A knock on the kitchen door would get something that had just run out replenished. If you are expecting an American style breakfast and/or table service then plan to eat elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in two rooms types one the Petite Queen and the other the Deluxe Queen. Yes the rooms are small, but for short stay perfectly acceptable,clean and well laid out. I found the beds to be comfortable. If there are two of you and you like hanging your things up then the Petite Queen is not for you, as it only has a single closet. The Deluxe Queen has adequate closet space, on par with most hotels I've stayed in. The bathrooms have all that you need and the amenities provided are a nice touch. There is some noise from outside, but this is New York and I didn't find it intrusive. The heating was effective and relatively quiet. If you are used to radiator style heating systems you may be bothered by the noise of fan based heating system.
reviews.title: Perfect place for NY getaway...

likes.disliked: — Room size - but this is NYC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Library Hotel based on the reviews here too. And, they were not wrong!!! This is a lovely, lovely place to stay. I travel a lot and this is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. Our room was gorgeous, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom spotless and a great size. The staff at the hotel were always friendly, attentive and helpful. The wine and cheese are a plus in the evenings. The roof top bar is nice (although the prices are a little steep) but I guess you pay for the location. The hotel is perfectly located - by 2 subway stations - it didn't take more than 10 minutes to get to the Upper East Side or downtown to The Village!! Couldn't recommend a hotel more!
reviews.title: LOVED IT ALL!

likes.disliked: — There was nothing I didn't like!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised by the whole experience. Risked the booking based upon online reviews. Great place to stay, great location (walking and cab distance to everything downtown, 2-3 blocks from subways and Grand Central Station). Contrary to some reviews about the size, it was just right for what most people come to NYC for: a great place to stay, sleep, refresh, then go out and play! Amenities (continental b-fast and wine/cheese) are great. Staff is friendly and helpful. You can dress like a real person here, too. Not hoity toity. Noted lots of Euro guests as well as US. We've stayed at several NYC hotels in past and will return here before going anywhere else.
reviews.title: Everything I expected and more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I came to NYC for the first time in several years. I saw this hotel on Fine Living as one of a top 10 romantic destinations. We were so very impressed! We booked a junior king suite, and it had plenty of room. Not at all like the previous places we have stayed in the city. The location was really great being so close to Grand Central, and there were so many wonderful restaurants right in the neighborhood. The breakfast every morning was just wonderful, and the afternoon wine and cheese, well! was just great! A nice little break before heading out for a wonderful dinner. The staff was really helpful, and we did not suffer any disappointment! The rooftop garden was really beautiful, and apparently a hoppin nightlife spot for those working on Madison Avenue. We will definitely return to this hotel , and it won't be so long next time!
reviews.title: Great stay
A great find!
reviews.text: My husband and i have just returned from a 7 day stay at the Library, as we were in new york from Scotland for our wedding. The hotel staff were excellent, informed and friendly, and appeared genuinely interested in each of the guests. When they discovered we were to be married, complementary champagne and a congratulations card were awaiting us in our room. The room was nice, well appointed and spacious and the bathrooms larger than the average for new york. The rooftop terrace bar was beautiful, and though regularly hired out for private functions, we were able to use in on several occassions. The reading room on level 2 is very calm and peaceful and we certainly made use of its free tea, coffee, pastries and cheese and wine!! The location of the Library is excellent - 2 mins walk from Grand Central Station, the Chrysler building, and beautiful Bryant park. We will both definitely make the Library our hotel of choice for our next visit to New York. Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Although I am a 'big-boned gal' I found the petite single rooms a perfect size. Everything is efficiently laid out, immaculately clean and perfectly stocked, and I did not feel cramped or inhibited, unlike some of the other reviewers. The staff are on the ball, polite and always available, the common areas (the reading room and the rooftop terrace) are great places to sit and relax, and were never crowded or off limits when I was there. At $225 a night (through the hotel's own website) I thought it excellent value.
reviews.title: Bijou - Small and Exquisite

likes.disliked: — A little far from the subway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Where do I start? First and foremost, I FOUND the place as a result of Tripadvisor. The property is exactly as the comments indicate. YES it's a great small boutique hotel, so if you like those 18 elevator lobby hotels that double as rent-a-car facilities, this isn't your place; YES this place has great staff, in fact, they helped me with a very early check in, which was most appreciated; YES this place has a very wide assortment of DVDs to watch (that is, if you really get bored and have nothing else to do, which is really hard in a city like NYC); YES the rooms are small, but who cares? I'm not buying the place; the beds are comfortable, the bathrooms spotless.
reviews.title: Great Sanctuary in Otherwise Crazy Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Added perks: (1) continental breakfast; (2) excellent espresso machine, juice, filtered water, juice, milk, baked goods, cookies, and fruit 24 hours a day; (3) great wine and cheese event every night; (4) folks, the windows in the room open all the way (5) the hotel lies on madison, but only a few rooms actually face it, that said, the hotel is on an otherwise "quiet" street (relative term for new york, but still quiet) (6) a very popular upstair open-air rooftop bar is a hit with the locals, and for good reason.
reviews.title: Amazing place

likes.liked: — Friendly and helpful staff; Location; Wine and cheese reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You know what else is cool? THEY READ THESE. Hey guys!!! So, they care about all of this - which is a step in the right direction, I say.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in NYC! We will be back!
A Bookish Treat
reviews.text: That said, thanks for a great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I selected the Library Hotel based on the reviews I'd read on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. The place really is amazing. I was travelling alone on business and this hotel was a high point in the trip. The friendly open spaces, the wine and cheese reception each evening and the staff for whom nothing was too much trouble were a welcome respite from the usual corporate hotels. The bedroom is small (in typical Manhattan style) but atypically there are so many places within the hotel where you can work or relax, and exchange a friendly word with other guests, that time spent in your room can be minimised. What more can I say? - I'll definitely return when next in the US and highly recommend the Library Hotel to any traveller. The hotel made my business travel a pleasure.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. The staff were marvellous - friendly and attentive, the room was comfortable and the shower was lovely and powerful (ours at home is rubbish, so I look forward to travelling to have a bit of pressure in the jets). I loved having a glass of prosecco before heading out in the evening and the tea and coffee facilities were a big plus for us. The breakfast was ok, but we did go out most mornings as I love love love American pancakes. The location was superb - very close to Bryant park and the lovely christmas market and skating.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I had a three night stay at Library Hotel, and it was wonderful. Right from the moment I entered the door, I had friendly and attentive assistance from the doorman, to the night manager that checked me into my room. The room I stayed in had beautiful high celings, soft dark wood features, and mirrors that created depth. I loved the full sized desk, and the fact that the TV was not the center of the room and could be hidden. The book selections that were available were actually books I would want to read. Everything from the updated weather report by the clock, to the complimentary shampoo, to the cleanlienss and size of the bathroom was fantastic. I normally am very stressed out when I'm in NYC, especially for business, and it was wonderful to go back to my hotel and feel at home. The lounge/bar upstairs was quite nice too.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the 24hr reading/breakfast room. With a baby grand piano, and a wonderful assortment of real food, and again, books I would or have actually read, I felt like I found my place. I mention the food, because normally complimentary breakfasts are stale, greasy, and can't be adapted to whatever food restrictions or preferences one has. Not so at Library Hotel - they had fresh fruit constantly, and fruit salad, kosher yogurts, fresh squeezed orange juice and grapefruit juice, and scones and healthy breads that wanted to be eaten. The provided coffee, and then went steps beyond. You could create your own cappichino, latte, or whatever, and there was always a helpful attendent clearing the tables quitely, toasting bagles, or bringing out mroe fresh fruit salad.
reviews.title: Comfortable and focused on the extras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only critique would be that my room tended towards being warmer than I like, and one of the duvet covers had a rip in the seam. That being said, I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Look forward to return visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was my second visit to New York and my first stay at the Library Hotel. I stayed with my husband for 2 weeks. The other reviews are spot on - it is comfortable, great location and most importantly, focused on the extras. For me, this distinguishes this hotel from other places.
reviews.title: I shouldn't tell you about this gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new wife & I ( married on the day we arrived in new York) stayed at the library hotel for 3 nights from Monday 18th march. From the point we contacted the hotel to let them know we would be checking in late @ 1am & asking them to arrange a car pick up their service has been 5* and I'm a very picky individual. The employees are all genuinely warm & welcoming, nothing is ever too much trouble. The location is amazing, just around the corner from grand central station & Bryant park. We ended up getting the metro & air train to jfk. Subway ride was$2.75 & the AirTrAin is $5. Our advice is to use the metro journey planner as it saved our feet a lot & we consider ourselves fit too!
reviews.title: Best location & best service in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I researched this hotel a lot and advise you to book through the hotels website directly and use the booklovers deal where you get 20% off for paying straight away. The breakfast is top notch & they even had take away cup options which was a bonus.
reviews.title: You can't get better than the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are returning here in 8 days & can't wait to see everyone again. If you like a historic hotel with a great bar & restaurant you must stay here. There was no other hotel we could see that was more suited to us.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.s try the deli next door, they are so friendly and the sandwiches are fab!
reviews.title: Perfect last stop of Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was probably because the two of us chose the tiniest room option, but the petite room was truly the smallest room I have ever stayed in (smaller than Harry Potter's cupboard under the stairs, I guarantee you). There was space enough in the room for a twin-sized bed and a desk, and perhaps a foot of space between the bed and the television/fridge/closet. The bathroom was fine in size; the tub and toilet separated from the sink by a door.
reviews.title: The best little hotel in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: It would be a real challenge to design a smaller room. About 18 inches on each side of the bed and a galley bathroom mean a couple would be extremely cramped with 1 suitcase. The location is terrific, and the hotel amenities are excellent. The roof top bar is a true NYC find, and the main floor bistro was excellent. So if you do not suffer from claustrophobia,the Library could be perfect for you.
reviews.title: Petite is an overstatement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really great experience here in this themed hotel. The "Petit" rooms are just that - small and simple, with just what you need to crash out. Breakfast was again simple and continental - just what I needed.
reviews.title: Loved the theme

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a problem with the flush on the toilet, which was promptly fixed.
reviews.title: A Real Haven and Very Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Price at $230 for the night was very reasonable by New York standards. Recommended.
reviews.title: Hotel for Book Lovers
Charming, comfortable and a nice "find."
reviews.text: What a find! The Library was recommended and it was a delight. Couldn't fault it. Perhaps the rooms are a little small but they were well decorated with beautiful bathrooms. Perfectly located in Mid-Town Manhattan, the hotel offers a roof terrace to chill out and free wine, tea, coffee and nibbles from mid-afternoon. The indoor-outdoor restaurant adjoining offered a great menu - if a little expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from an exceptional, three-night stay at the Library Hotel. The hotel is immaculate, the staff is outstanding, and the location is ideal for exploring all New York has to offer.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel with Outstanding Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed on the eighth floor in a junior suite, and it was perfect for us. The room had plenty of closet space, a sitting area with couch and table, and very warm decor. Upon arrival, there was a bottle of wine and a box of chocolates in celebration of my husband's birthday. Hotel staff member Tim Gerhold went above and beyond in helping plan this special stay, and we weren't disappointed in a thing. The level of service he provides is second to none, and was the ultimate reason we chose this hotel. Thank you Tim! Other staffers - Jessica and Graig - were also excellent. Jessica helped in advance with restaurant suggestions, and welcomed us warmly when we arrived. She and Tim seemed genuinely interested in making our stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Favorite place to stay in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very happy with the continental breakfast in the morning, and the wine and cheese hours in the evening. The staff who work in this room were also friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Surpassed our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We really appreciated the quietness of this hotel. There is no loud nightclub music to deal with, and no noisy parties to disrupt you. In the midst of the craziness of midtown, we enjoyed returning to the hotel for some peace and quiet, and to recharge before heading out for the evening.
reviews.title: Luxury and a great bargain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll be sure to stay at the Library Hotel when we return to New York. If service, comfort, cleanliness, and an amazing staff is important to you - look no further than 41st and Madison! You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Location plus great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I love the well-designed snug little double rooms with all the books, as we always have --even better than a bigger room we tried once. Someday maybe we'll even get the luck of the draw and score a room that features some books we'd especially enjoy like Mysteries or Fiction. But the best feature is the second-floor Reading Room where we enjoyed breakfast that included protein (eggs) and homemade oatmeal (new offering since our last stay) as well as the usual good coffee and pastries. Ask for soy milk if you are lactose-intolerant as I am now. And the late-afternoon wine period offers hospitality to guests and their guests, for which we made ample use with local family and friends.
reviews.title: Fourth stay at the Library as good at the first

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is in a great localization. Just a block from the New York Public Library/Bryant Park and Grand Central Terminal. Very nice neighborhood. A 10 minutes walk from Madison Square Garden, 15 minute walk through 5th avenue, to Central Park.
reviews.title: Very well localizated and Excelent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff is great! Everyone trying to please you as much as they can, making you feel right at home from the minute you step into the lobby until the moment of saying goodbye.
reviews.title: Lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were very nice, clean, tidy, the welcome was very warm, with a prosecco bottle. I don't feel the need of posting photos, since the hotel site publicity describe the rooms very accurately. The Wine and Cheese at 5pm is a must. Waiter are wonderful, serving all kinds of cheese, aperitifs, juices, wine, crackers, etc. Definitely the place I will stay in when I go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited the Library hotel on a recent trip to New York to visit his parents. The room was clean, efficiently designed given its small space, warm, and the restroom was newly renovated. We enjoyed the experience from top to bottom. Bookmarks lounge on the top floor had a great atmosphere and delicious signature cocktails. The free wine and cheese display was phenomenal. Prosecco & smoked Gouda cheese- oh la la! We also frequented Madison & Vine, the restaurant downstairs, and it was fantastic as well. The library's central location, friendly staff and wonderful accommodations were fantastic.
reviews.title: Outstanding!!
Felt like we were invited guests
reviews.text: We just spent a four day weekend at the Library and were treated like invited guests. We choose the hotel on the recommendation of a family member so we were prepared for the small rooms but the decor and additional features (water, bottle opener, personal items, robes etc) more than compensated for the lack of square footage. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly and even came to the rescue when our 14 year old son had to stay over a night after his flight from Kennedy was canceled at the last minute.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: We also appreciated having available the 2nd floor complimentary breakfast/ wine and cheese and 24 hour snack room as well as the roof top bar for cocktails where we like many other guests met and shared the facility with friends including non hotel guests who vow that they too will stay at the Library on their next visit.
reviews.title: Restored my mood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location in midtown is perfect for visitors interested in exploring the city. We walked from the hotel many times and never had a problem hailing a cab when we were going further afield.
reviews.title: Best Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only place to stay in Manhattan for price, service and amenities.
reviews.title: It's true it's perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was Sunday, and all flights at JFK were delayed or cancelled. Rather than wait around for a flight that would never materialize, I decided to rebook it for the next day and spend the night in Manhattan. I first tried the Sofitel but didn't like the price they were charging. Then I remembered reading about the Library in a travel magazine -- and what a find it turned out to be.
reviews.title: Loved It

likes.liked: — Library theme which is carried into the rooms & location
likes.disliked: — Views from the front of the building, 41st Street offices rather than Madison Ave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Library Hotel in October after I had chosen it using reviews on Trip Advisor. We thought it was excellent. The room and bathroom were clean (but compact) and stylish. The breakfasts were excellent and the complimentary wine and cheese each afternoon was an added bonus. The staff were generally friendly and helpful (although the girl who checked us out was an exception). One small niggle was that the air conditionaer in the room was quite noisy - but being Ocotber we were able to switch it off. Overall, though, we really enjoyed our stay and will recommend all our friends to stay there
reviews.title: Excellent Library Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from 3 night stay at this hotel. Great location for all the sights, shows and shopping. Front desk staff very helpful. We booked the queen size room, enough space for 2 of us and luggage, well -designed. Loved the 2nd floor lounge, nice place to relax after a day of walking. We will be back !
reviews.title: Great hotel and location
Like a really good book.....didn't want it to end!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Library Hotel for 5 nights in May. From the minute we arrived the service was impeccable. Our taxi door had hardly opened when a member of reception staff welcomed us and helped with luggage. We arrived before usual check-in time and the staff couldn't have been more helpful in having our rooms ready as quickly as possible. The hotel location is excellent and couldn't have been better for us. The breakfast was lovely with a good selection and the availability of tea, coffee and pastries etc all day was great. After exhausting days seeing the fabulous sights of NYC we enjoyed the wine, cheese and snacks most evenings before venturing out! Our room was very small though very nicely appointed. Am sure we'll return and next time we'd book a larger room but aside from this the Library Hotel is something very special! Thank-you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and couldn't fault it. It was located just a block from Grand Central and was so handy for all the sights. Breakfast was included and free refreshments all day as well as wine, cheese and nibbles at 5pm every evening.
reviews.title: The first of many (we hope!) trips to the big apple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We bought a New York Pass for three days and found it invaluable. It saved us a fortune as well as priority queuing .
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel Midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were exhausted but happy at the end of our time and saw an awful lot of New York.
reviews.title: Spectacular! A dream hotel!

description: The Library Hotel boasts over 6000 hand-selected books organized by the Dewey Decimal System. With a very central midtown Manhattan location, the hotel is within walking distance of The New York Public Library, Grand Central Terminal, The Empire State Building and Times Square, to name just a few. Take advantage of The Library Hotel Collection’s signature Continental Breakfast Buffet and evening wine and cheese reception in our Reading Room. Cappuccino, water, fruit, cookies and pastries are available in this space for our guests 24 hours a day. Also included with your reservation is complimentary WiFi and passes to the nearby New York Sports Club. Visit our indoor and outdoor rooftop, Bookmark’s Lounge, for literary themed cocktails and small plates.
